node.title: These texts to Trump's former top aide during the Capitol riot show why his testimony could be key
node.alt: White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows greets supporters of Donald Trump.
node.description: The name Mark Meadows may not ring a bell, but a US committee investigating January's attack on the Capitol believes his testimony could be key.
node.content:
["Donald Trump's former chief of staff\u00a0has been held in contempt of Congress.", "The name Mark Meadows may not ring a bell, but a US committee investigating January's attack on the Capitol believes\u00a0his testimony could be key.", "That's because he was Mr Trump's top aide at the time and was with him in the White House as the rioters breached the Capitol building.", "Here's what we know so far.", "
Hang on, who is Mark Meadows?
", "Mark Meadows was the 29th White House chief of staff, serving from 2020 to 2021 under Donald Trump.", "He played an influential role within the Trump administration, and aided the former president's efforts to overturn the results of the US election.", "Since leaving the White House, Mr Meadows has released a memoir which purports to tell the story of \"how he and a close team of loyal advisors helped President Trump navigate one of the worst years in American history\".", "In it, he addresses\u00a0the January 6 riot at the US Capitol\u00a0and accuses critics of focusing \"on the actions of a handful of fanatics across town\".", "The investigating committee is particularly interested in revelations about that day.", "
So why is Mark Meadows\u00a0being held in contempt?
", "The committee said it was left with no choice after Mr Meadows refused to cooperate with the investigation.", "He cited executive privilege, a legal principle protecting White House communications.", "It's important to note, however, that claiming executive privilege isn't\u00a0actually up to him, because he's no longer in the White House.", "That decision now rests with President Joe Biden \u2014 and for what it's worth, he\u00a0shot down a similar attempt in October by Donald Trump, who claimed executive privilege in a bid to prevent documents from his time in office being accessed.", "Now, this is all\u00a0a remarkable turnabout because Mr Meadows\u00a0initially declared his intention of cooperating\u00a0on certain areas of the committee's inquiry.", "But just a week later, he decided to sue the committee, accusing it of overreach.", "", "
Bennie Thompson was particularly critical of Mr Meadows.(Reuters:\u00a0Jonathan Ernst)
", "\"His former colleagues singling him out for criminal prosecution because he wouldn\u2019t answer questions about what he knows about a brutal attack on our democracy. That\u2019s his legacy.\"", "
What does the committee think Mark Meadows knows?
", "Well, a fair bit.", "Remember how he initially agreed to cooperate with the investigation? As part of that, he voluntarily handed over text messages and emails.", "And now the committee wants more.", "Liz Cheney, the investigating committee\u2019s vice-chair, detailed a series of text messages Mr Meadows received on January 6 from a slew of people, including Fox News anchors and Donald Trump Jr.", "In the texts, allies and those in Mr Trump\u2019s inner circle attempted to reach him through his chief of staff, imploring him to take action against the violence that was taking place outside and inside the Capitol.", "The committee also wants to know more about whether Mr Trump was engaged in discussions regarding the response of the National Guard, which was delayed for hours as the violence escalated.", "The documents provided by Mr Meadows include an email he sent to an unidentified person saying that the Guard would be present to \u201cprotect pro-Trump people\".", "
Does this mean Mark Meadows has been charged?
", "Nope, not exactly.", "Mark Meadows is the third former Trump associate to face the threat of criminal charges\u00a0for refusing to cooperate with the committee.", "", "
Steve Bannon has\u00a0been charged with two counts of contempt of Congress.(AP:\u00a0Eduardo Munoz Alvarez)
", "That includes\u00a0former Trump strategist Steve Bannon, who has\u00a0been charged with two counts of contempt of Congress.", "Once the committee reports on its efforts to force someone to comply (as we've seen today), it then goes to the House of Representatives for a vote.", "If it's upheld, the case will be referred to the Department of Justice, which will determine if charges are laid.", "ABC/wires"]
